comment: The professor himself is friendly. But he rambles on and on, making the lectures practically useless. He then tests you on his lectures that you get nothing from. His D2L content is practically unreadable and in hieroglyphics. It's very hard to know what he's trying to say. He also like RARELY gives over 90 on assignments making the class a hard A.

He is a great instructor. He is always willing to help students. There are 5-6 essay type assignments throughout the semester on what the entire grade is based on. If you get 90% + in all assignments then the final is exempt and you'll get an A. I would definitely recommend if a student wants to pass course with good grades.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: 5 assignments comprise the entire grade. Midterm can take up to a week and is a minimum of 5 pages; the final exam is very similar. People tend to complain about him not teaching, but those same people do not show up to class. He will take attendance if the classroom looks empty to him. Challenging course if you do not show up. No group projects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Shaver was the best professor I've ever had. He's worked in 11 startups as a CEO, CFO, and COO as well as director roles. He met with many big names in the tech industry over the years and has experience in international business as well. All of his classes are very similar and the assignments are all the same. No tests and no group projects.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are ok with getting a B in the class you should take him. He gave tasks during the semester which were just essays about random IS topics. He graded them very subjectively with few people getting an A on the tasks. Most people got a mid to high B on them. His lectures were very fun to listen to and had some real-world advice.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Had 7 "tasks" that were mad easy for me. This is my second time taking him by far the best as a teacher. His assignments do take work but just be sure to explain your opinions and you should get an A. Lectures are kinda random I just used them for ideas for the assignments. He is a harder grader compared to others.

Graded by small projects that are put into a big one at the end, the grading scale is literally whether he likes it or not; but it is easy to get a good grade, just show you know what you're talking about.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took this class with Professor Shaver as well as 3220 and 3040 and he is amazing! He really knows his stuff and gives real life advice from working out in the field. He gives out 6 assignments and two tests. The second test is the final exam and he lets you exempt if you make a 95 on the assignments or midterm. Im excited to take him for 4860!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He was not a good teacher at all. There were 6 assignments, 1 of them being optional, and 2 tests where you could exempt the final. He grades so harshly for no reason, is hard to get a hold of outside of class, and his lectures have nothing to do with the class. The syllabus doesnt plan out the assignments either & he doesnt give clear answers.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I can't say enough good things about Shaver. He is arguably the BEST professor at KSU. I've taken him for 4860, 3060, and 3220 and he never fails to impress. Yes he is a tough grader, but you will learn what it takes to impress him (subjective grader!). 6 assignments, 1 midterm, and a final that you can exempt if you get a 95 on anything! TAKE HIM!

Great prof who really cares about you, he gives a series of assignments which do take a lot of time. His mid term is 10 questions that took me 6-8 hours to complete and with the midterm there is no correct answer, he wants to make sure you know the material this way. Very fun classes keeps them interesting.

Professor Shaver is a great choice, hilarious in classrooms and will be completely honest with you regarding material and real life scenarios. There are 6 assignments, and a 95 on just one exempts you from the final. Incredibly hard to get above a 95 on assignments and you need to enjoy writing because this class will make you work for it.

He's very unique, I enjoyed his lectures. There were only a few assignments but they are very tough. Had a few late nights, midterm especially. Be mindful of due dates as he chooses random times (ex: 10:32 AM). If you get a 95+ on any assignment (very hard to do! I only got one 95.), you exempt the final. Actually learned a lot from him. Take him!

Very odd class structure no actual quizzes or tests. There are only about 5 assignments but they take forever and have no real rubric. But if you actually show that you are trying he gives you a good grade.
He makes you work for your grades but overall he's a good professor who knows what he's talking about. I will take him again would definitely recommend him to others.

Shaver's classes are made up of 6 assignments throughout the semester. They are not exactly hard, but do not expect to receive an A without more work on your end. His grading criteria is subjective, and he tells you this. Despite this, I still liked his class. The workload is relatively low if you're willing to take a gamble on the grade.

I Wont take this professor again ever. I got a good grade in this class, but not easily. He does not warn you when assigning assignments, does not tell you what your final class grade will consist of, grades harshly with no reason why he graded it as such, does not explain what you need to do for assignments, and does not warn you of EXAMS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: The class centered around six assignments, a midterm, and a final that you got to exempt if you made a 95 or more on the assignments or midterm. He is a bit of a tough grader, but hes fair. Hell give you a B if he sees you at least tried. He wants to see you succeed, but you have to think for yourself, as you will have to in the business world.

IS3100. Class is super boring, I barely showed up, the work is super easy I literally didn't take a test the whole semester didn't even know what the class was about but I got a B. So def would take him again.

Honestly, he is a nice guy and he is obviously very intelligent. However, his grading style is just not reasonable. He gives 0 grading criteria and minimal feedback. If you think your work is an A, its probably a C. He's just not a fair educator. If he is not a fan of your writing style, you won't make an A.

His material in his class is not related to Information Systems at all and he does not give rubrics for grading. You are lucky if you receive a 90 on simple assignments you know you deserved above a 90 on. The way he grades is irrational and it seems almost as if he just makes up the grade. All his lectures are just him ranting his opinion. No go.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very interesting prof. Not a reason to show to class besides the rare pop quizzes. He's not the typical prof, disagrees with 98% of what the textbook says, and puts his own spin on it. Very realistic prof. Most of your grade is based on writing. Extremely hard to get an A on those. If u manage a 95+ on one, you can exempt the final. Very few do

Shaver's classes have less rigid structure than others and his grading criteria can seem vague, but I found it helped me understand the material better. Instead of memorizing facts, he wants you to apply what you learned in written assignments, usually one or two a week. You get back the effort you put in, so go to lectures and pay attention!

I get why people have an issue with Shaver but I absolutely love him. He allows you to be as creative as you'd like with assignments and as long as he sees you have put in the effort, you'll get a decent grade. "Wow" him and you'll get an A. A *HARD* class to get an A in and you have to work for it - but if you put in the effort you'll be fine.

Professor Shaver is truly the most unique and memorable professor you will ever take! He will teach you business skills more so than the intricacies of IS and you will have to think hard for yourself. He has high expectations for your work and is vague in his assignments so it is up to you to determine how to "wow" him. You will learn to think.

Guys... this was by far the toughest class I have ever had. Please do yourself a favor and do not bother. I went to every class. Study for weeks and weeks and the tests were just so ridiculous and out of pocket that I almost failed.
I definitely agree with the comment below. This class was extremely, unnecessarily hard. I do not recommend taking this class and definitely would not take again.

Shaver was probably one of the hardest professors I have ever had to encounter and would not recommend taking him ever. I tried my hardest in every single class, showed up to every class, and still barely passed. Do not take this class.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Shaver is one of a kind. He truly cares about his students. Do the assignments and go above and beyond his requirements (not hard to do), and you will do great! He is more than willing to help and gives great career advice for when you get out into the real world. Take hm for as many IS classes as possible.

I took him back in fall of 2018 and he was one of the best professors i've ever had at KSU. His lectures taught alot of life skills and I really enjoyed doing his projects and he lets you get creative with them. He's a very tough grader and he seems intimidating at first but he's willing to help you if you're struggling.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Professor Shaver's class was an interesting experience. Aside from the tough grading, his classes are very lecture heavy. But those lectures are interesting and you truly want to listen to them. He's also a very accommodating professor, I was out for almost half the summer course and he still allowed me to catch up. Do not overthink his teaching.

Professor Shaver is a very interesting guy. Set aside grades and focus on actually learning something. If you desire to learn about the world from a very tested individual than I highly recommend him. If you're not looking to expand your mind and thing outside the box, I would look for another professor.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Russel Shaver is my favorite professor in the IS department, he cares about his students and will teach you something about life. He knows a lot about technology and has been working in technology for all of his life if you take him you will learn something about your career.

Shaver is a gem in the IS department. I have had him 5 previous times, and I wish he taught more subjects besides IS. All of his classes are the same with about 4 assignments, and a mid term and final. If you get a 95 on any of the assignments, you can exempt the final exam. He is very personal, and he wants you to succeed in college and in life.

Professor Shaver is not your typical professor. His classes tend to be lecture-heavy but interesting to hear, he grades your assignments very subjectively, and his rubrics are very VERY vague. As daunting as that sounds, it can be very easy as long as you "don't overthink". His lectures are knowledge-based and full of personal testimonies.

Weird class . He grades based on how he feels , has no clear grading criteria. The projects have no direction what so ever , very vague . Takes attendance occasionally but no one goes to class because his lectures are very random . If you get a 95 on an assignment you dont have to take the final .

Professor Shaver is an interesting human. He can come off a little narcissistic but he was very realistic about life outside of college. I found his lectures to be pretty interesting and his assignments were pretty easy to make a B on. A's are a lot harder to get because he does not give them very frequently, but overall I liked this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Shaver is different from most professors. All of the grades are based on projects, aside from the midterm and the final. The projects aren't too hard and it's all stuff you can do without going to class. He doesn't lecture about anything of importance and if you don't show up all semester but do the projects you can get an A.

Not a fan of this professor. Lectures felt pointless because most of them felt like we were attending some sort of ramble session of his and felt unproductive. Your entire grade is predicated on essays meaning subjective grading. The class is an easy B, but it's laughably hard to get an A on most assignments. Pick someone else if you can.

If you like writing papers this is your class. However, all assignments are graded from his perspective. No real rubric or guidance of what he wants an then if you write something he didn't want gives you a 70. Probably be better off with a different professor. On the plus, you don't have to show up to class.

Ok, this man is a genius. He promotes creativity, by assigning projects with relaxed rubrics that allow the student to decide what the Memo/Powerpoint/Excel assignment will be about. Show up, listen, work very hard, and you'll get an A. I had him two semesters ago, and he made a writing class become the best class I (an accounting major) ever took.
Shaver is the most real professor I have ever had. He doesn't teach you BS. you teaches you how to think out of the box and be creative. Easiest B ever. An A if you put in some effort.

LOVE HIM! Hardly ever went to class since all assignments were online (Also forgives late assignments!) He isn't the most traditional grader but I believe that works in everyones favor. Easiest B I ever made. No textbook needed. Definitely taking him again!

This class is crazy easy. Each assignment is online and he usually gives about a week to do. If you put some effort towards each assignment you'll get an automatic B. If you choose to actually try you MIGHT get an A. But thats if he really likes it. I only showed up 3x the whole semester. Do yourself a favor and TAKE IT!

LOVE LOVE LOVE professor Shaver, his class was a breeze currently still in the class but easy A hardly had to go to class. Grading is here and there but If you have common sense and Google you'll be able to find the information. Very few grades Midterm needs to be in his format
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This man will believe anything you tell him. Don't worry about being factual or having sources for any of his assignments because as long as its feasible he'll accept it as fact. That translates directly into his lectures - which are useless - don't believe him and fact check everything. His assignment grading standards are also completely skewed.

Professor Shaver does expect you to think. He will not walk you through on how to complete an assignment. With that being said, Google is your best friend. However, he will answer any questions you may have about the assignments just as long as you show some effort. He is a solid choice, and an A is totally attainable.

Professor Shaver's Class is definitely not the usual college class. He wants you to think and not memorize answers. With that being said, you do have to work for your grade, but it so worth it at the end. As long as you go above and beyond of the minimum requirements, you should receive an excellent grade.

simply do each assignment and receive a B, the instructions are confusing and he can be vague but turn in SOMETHING and you will get a B. Final and midterm are essay based but like the assignment you will get a B by simply completing. Deff dont pass

Shaver is an interesting professor. His teaching style is unique and laid back. He lectures about real-world scenarios and does not follow a text book at all. His grading style is based on his opinions of your work and to get an A, you must impress him. He treats the class like a business, which is helpful to prepare for a career is business.

Shaver is such a good professor. I enjoyed taking his class in the fall. If you want an A you have to work for it because very few people make an A. However, it is manageable if you play your cards right and do everything correctly..

At the beginning of the semester I was not a fan, but as time passed he may just be one of the greatest professors. His class is not set up like most and he genuinely cares about the information he is teaching. He gives real work scenarios and wants you to actually use your mind instead of rehearsing terms to know. Show up to class & you'll be fine
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Shaver is awesome just go to class and you're guaranteed a B.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Shaver is interesting. He's a really laid back guy who's not afraid to speak his mind. If you get a 95 on any assignment you get to exempt the final, but you really have to impress him to get a 95. Some assignments can be difficult and time consuming, but overall they're not too bad. Classes are typically pretty short. Not a bad choice.

Shaver is a seasoned Professional with a lifetime of experience spanning from the military to technology startups. Professor Shaver's goal in all of his classes is to help his students to grow and become as hireable. His classes aren't too hard but you get out of his courses but he has been known to help students find jobs well

Who are you? Are you anybody? I dont know. Thats for you to decide. Or is it? You decide... If you understood what I just typed out, you'll do just fine. However, if you did not understand, have fun trying to find out what he wants from you. He's a pretty vague guy but it's interesting. The class forces you to think in odd ways.

His lectures were very entertaining ; he's not afraid to speak his mind. His two essay exams are tough, takes a lot of time if you want to put the effort into it. HIs other assignments were easy enough. If you just put the basics into each on, you'll pass but if you want to get an A, the more you explore and add to the assignments, the better.

Professor Shaver is a realist. If you're a thinker, you will get WAY more out of his class than a traditional academic. If you have an option on your schedule and he's an option, take it before its gone.

Shaver is a great professor to take if you actually want to learn about real business stuff. If you'd rather read a boring textbook and regurgitate material back in a scantron test, this is not the professor for you. Around 5 assignments and mid-term and final are long answer essays which you have a week or two to complete. I recommended him!

Coolest professor ever - you can tell he loves inspiring his students. Sometimes the lectures are long, but he is a really great teacher. The assignments are not hard, but he does want you to think outside of the box and critically think. NO quizzes, just mid-term, final exam, and like 5 projects. I would retake him again in a heartbeat!!

Shaver is a unique professor. He grades based on a handful of assignments and two exams. If you make a 95 or above on any assignment or midterm, you exempt the final. The problem: he hands out 85's like candy, but you really have to WOW him to get that 95. It is possible, but you have to go beyond the requirements. His lectures can be confusing.

Professor Shaver is a good choice when it comes to Information Systems. He has clear grading criteria. As long as you do well enough on the mid-term, you can t exempt the final! I totally recommend him!

5 assignments, mid-term and final. Easiest B you can get. He is an extremely tough grader for As. As long as you turn in an assignment you are guaranteed an 84 at the lowest. He will hand out 88s and 89s like candy. Have to put in a lot of extra work for that 90+. Never went to class, but still managed an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easiest class ever, only went about 5 times the whole semester. He doesn't want you to buy the book, and you only have assignments due online. He doesn't give many instructions to assignments so you'll have to figure it out. Allows you to turn things in a day late with no points taken. Attendance is extra credit taken randomly.

Shaver has 5 grades besides the Midterm and Final, that make you use Excel, Word, and PowerPoint documents. They all make you think a little bit but it's sort of interesting. The MIDTERM AND FINAL are very important, BUT, if you do really good on 1 assignment, you can SKIP the FINAL. More importantly, you can't fail, he makes it very easy.
Class is an easy B. Hes very vague with what he wants you to do on assignments but as long as you turn something decent in you'll get a B

One of the best professors I've had at KSU. He has lots of experience and a wealth of knowledge. Doesn't make you buy the textbook. He won't spoon-feed you. He wants you to ask questions and call him out when he says something wrong. Might be hard if you need lots of structure but he is very lenient on grading and turning in late work if you try.

Going to class is a waste. He flips through PowerPoint slides within 30 seconds saying "you don't need to know this" only so he can start talking about his son and family. I probably know more about his son than I do information systems now. He does occasionally take attendance for a small percent of your grade. The textbooks are a MUST.

Shaver is one of the best professors at KSU because he does not BS the student; he tells you how it is going to be in the real world. His instructions are vague because he wants you to figure it out yourself. If you enjoy a challenge, but also enjoy learning and not just regurgitating definitions, I highly recommend taking his class.

It is not an easy A but He is inspirational and give real life lesson. Take him if you are about learning. if you get an 95 on the mid term you do not take the final and you get an automatic 90 on it but be careful and ask questions.

Most of this class is devoted to the business case, charter, and plan. He isn't very clear with what he wants and this can be reflected in your grade. (Google will be ur bff) Try to find a good template online. There is 2 exams and each are (10) essay questions that you have a week to do. His exams took me 6-9 hours  each. Doesnt give feedback.

The midterm and final are short answer (essay) questions that you have to google and research to answer, You have a week or two to do them but it took me 5-8 hours to fully finish it. The lectures are boring & there is no organization to them (he rambles). He assigns assignments throughout the semester. He is picky with grades and not much feedback

Took him over the summer. He is a bit strange but very interesting. Class time was optional but I came everyday just to hear his lectures. They were irrelevant to the material, but contained great life advise. Also, If you turn in a assignment, even if it is total bs, the MINIMUM grade you will get is an 80. It's VERY EASY to get a B, but NOT an A.

Extremely unclear in what he wants but it's by design to make you think for yourself. If you're a control freak, run in the other direction. He wants to see that you thought hard about assignments, not for you to follow guidelines. Strange guy but I liked him. He gives 85s as a bare minimum, do good work and an A is attainable.

Shaver's class is insanely easy, you won't stress over it at all. He gives a few assignments with weird deadline dates, but allows you to turn them in late with no penalty. However, don't expect to make an A because he just gives 87's for every grade and gives you little to no feedback on how to improve. The lectures are pointless.

Let me start off by saying i have never taken the time out of my day to rate a professor before. Made an A in the class and this man teaches because he loves teaching. Doing the BARE MINIMUM guarantees you a B. With that being said, it is up to you and your efforts whether you want to achieve that A. A class that you actually can look forward to.

Best lectures! Gives great advice for the upcoming business world. Strongly emphasizes thinking! 10 assignments total. If you just do every assignment, that's a B. He does not give out free A's. If you think outside the box and put a lot of work into it, you will get an A. He is full of experience and goes his own way, no matter what others think.
he is AWESOME! fair and clear about his expectations! come to class, work hard and you will pass!

He gives outstanding life advice and insight on the business world. Would take his class solely for that purpose. Now for his grading, he is an emotional grader. He goes on how he feels about your work. He is strange, but in an interesting way. He does not give A's out easily. He MAKES you THINK, which was refreshing.

You will have t read if you expect t pass. Impossible to take notes, but he is a very good professor. Easy grader, but you will have to show you put effort. Assignments aren't to difficult, test are time consuming. Give some effort, get a B, give good effort and get an A. He has good stories. Don't need to show up.

No one else is going to say it? Fine, I'll be the one. His writing style is straight-up bizarre, but he will mention that in class. For someone who is amazing at lecturing, his written instructions are hard to follow and have awful grammar. "This exam is for electronic exam purposes!"  He's inspiring and credible, but rarely gives A's and says so

TAKE HIM! Funny, teaches REAL information, and honestly he's just a brilliant guy. For every class I've taken with him, all tests were essay style. You have at least a week to do it. They're not hard at all. Refer to the PPTs and ask questions. He will help if you ask for it. Follow directions and you can DEFINITELY get an A.

Professor Shaver is a great teacher and really cares about the information. I got high B's on all the assignments for just doing the bare minimum but the Midterm was a ridiculously easy A. "The 5 page paper" (from a comment below) was an individual project instead of with a group and it was easy. Best IS professor you'll find, highly recommend him!

He is not clear on what he wants at all. His tests were hard and so were the assignments. He will give you a B for putting effort into your work, but it is extremely difficult to get an A. The midterm and final, though open note and book, are extremely time consuming. Also have a 5-10 page paper due. Easy B NOT A.

One of the best professors I've ever had. While attendance isn't necessarily mandatory, he teaches you things that are valuable to know. He won't waste your time at all. Throw in a sense of humor and you have a highly recommended professor.

THE EASIEST PROFESSOR AT KSU! I took him for a 4 week session over the summer and as long as you turned in each assignment he gave you a 100. The midterm is open note/book and the final is in class. By far the easiest A i've ever made.

Easiest professor ever.Do some small assignments and they count for 100. Although it is hybrid he is not active online. Super hard to get him to post things or get a response from him. Never even opened the book. Spent $$$ on e-book and his notes were according to the hard cover. Never gives pages from the e-book.
Literally the easiest professor I have taken at KSU. Took him for a 4 week hybrid over the summer and as long as you did the small assignments you got a 100

Take Professor Shaver for every course he teaches. It is the straight path to success as an IS major. You will have to write a couple papers for him, and you may do a project, but his tests are notoriously easy, and he grades so leniently it's insane. I have had him for 4 classes now and graduate this summer. Take him whenever possible.

Awesome Professor. He is professional and teaches like a professor should.  He's real world. He's fair. Keeps class interesting. Makes your think for yourself! This is what  he wants you to learn to do. Great Person! TAKE HIM, U WONT REGRET!
Take him. Duh.

He is a easy professor that will make ou want to pull your hair out. No clear instructions on anything ever. On the postive side turn everything in and show up for class your a lock for a B wether you know the materal or not. If you know the materail which you pretty much have to self learn your a lock for an A.

Prof. Shaver is one of the coolest guys i have ever met with tons of real world experience. He has his own style of teaching which I adapt very well too I enjoy his class and the discussions we have in them. Rather than making you regurgitate facts from books he teaches you to think and learn for yourself. he is a very wise man.
Great teacher, real world experience, practical application. By far the best professor in the department.

You have to go to class and listen to the lectures or else you will receive good grades on the exams. Tests are essay style. No assignments, group project is easy. Get on his good side or else you will not get a good grade. He doesn't like giving out As.
Easy class just show up and do the assignments.Also pay attention to when he says "this will be a great question" that question will be on the test.
He teaches you how to learn what is relevant. The rest is just crap (technical term)
One of the best. Makes class interesting. Don't bother with the book. Tests are pretty strange. Still can't figure out his style but I still did well.

Easily the greatest professor that teaches at KSU. He makes you think about technology past and present, while attempting to get you to envision the future. If you can or have to take a class in this course make him you're first choice

Shaver is probably the most fun and interesting teacher at KSU.  His lectures are very interesting and original.  He doesn't teach out of the book and the grades are easy.  Once went to class and the board said "Are zombies real?"  and we discussed it.  Really makes you think about technology and its pros and cons in the future.
Excellent Professor!!!! Professor Shaver knows his stuff and delivers it well.
god teacher and really enjoys his subject, doesn't waste your time

Fantastic professor. Teaches from real world experience, not afraid to use the full spectrum of the English language, has lots of relevant anecdotes from previous jobs -- always willing to help if you want to learn. Best professor I've ever had.

Shaver is my favorite prof. in all of KSU. His classes are not the easiest, but they are the most interesting. He teaches from real world experience. He expects a lot from students, but makes you want to do well. I rec. taking anything he teaches.

Shaver is probably...the best..hands down professor in the IS department; I only wish he taught ISA too. Shaver should replace ALL of Sherri Shade's classes as she is more than just horrible. Shaver is a little too silly at times but he makes the class painless and you still learn! Now, that's an actual educator! He should totally teach more clases

Awesome prof. great break from the tedium of other professors. One of the only classes I've taken at KSU that truly had me thinking. Take him for sure. If your IS, you need to take him for something before you graduate.

Great professor!  Funny - makes the class and his class notes very enjoyable!  Let's you connect what you study in class with the real world.  He was always well prepared and never missed a class. Makes sure students know where the test will come from without giving too much information. Take him if you can.

A little confusing, but definitely an enjoyable class. I passed with flying colors and enjoyed every aspect, although nothing involved with computers interests me. Take this class, he is wonderful and it will serve as a comic relief for stressful times.

Best instructor I've had at KSU so far, hands down. He encourages you to study the book for tests, but I didn't even buy the thing and I aced his course. The class was very interesting and Shaver wants you to learn how to think for yourself, and his teaching & testing styles reflect that.

He's that professor that teaches in an unorthodox, engaging manner.  I can honestly say that I took more away from this class than I would have if I had taken someone else.  I am voluntarily taking another class with him this semester.

Shaver is an engaging business instructor with real world experience and technology history. The class is fun, and the material is interesting. Veteran geeks will likely doze off a few times during classes.

OMG! Dr. Shaver is one of the most awesome profs I have had since I started college. This class went from 8pm-10:45pm, & I actually looked forward to every single class. He has a great, laid back sense of humor & teaching. Can ramble a little sometimes, but definitely keeps you "into" the class. Easy assignments, easy tests, but you actually learn.

Incredibly good professor. Knows what he's talking about, experienced almost everything mentioned in the text book. Treats you like an adult, not a kid. Will use "technical terms" (swearing) on occasion, always hilarious. Keeps you active and engaged in the class, always lets out early. Don't know what everyone else's problem is, this guy is great.
A great professor. Keeps the class interesting, and is quite funny. Highly recommended~
